data.title: my my ...you love hiugh prices for bland pastry ??
data.text: the title about says it all...bland tastign bakery and over priced pastry and ice cream...maybe the rich can afford it but then i don't think the wealthy are hanging out in fullerton...this place is not worth it..

data.title: New Name, Same Owners
data.text: There was a bit of confusion with this café and another of the same name in Irvine.  No longer affiliated.  The bakery, formerly Layer Cake Bakery, in Fullerton, has a new name, BOLU Bakery and Café.  Owners and management is the same as before. They still have wonderful, mouth-watering bakery goods and lunch offerings. What I find frustrating, is the lack of table space for other customers due to the availability of free Wi-Fi.  So, if you want to order lunch and desert here, be prepared to take it with you.  This space is more than double the size of your regular Starbucks.  Same deal, drinking coffee and taking up space--lots of it!.

data.title: Excellent Lunch Spot in Downtown Fullerton
data.text: This is a cute spot with lots of tables and a variety of lunch items.  I got a quiche with turkey, potatoes, and spinach. Quite nice.  I will have to go back to try the great looking desserts

data.title: Yum
data.text: Ice cream/gelato was yummy. Piece of chocolate cake was good but not cheap and it was a relatively small piece.

data.title: Great Salads and treats
data.text: The gluten free desert choices were so great.  The salads had loads of fresh wonderful ingredients.  Home made ice cream was also a great feature.  It all tasted excellent.

data.title: You gotta give this place a shot
data.text:
First off, ALL of their freshly made baked goods, and there are a ton of them, are off the hook wonderful. Cake by the slice, individual desserts, all wonderful. To go or stuff your face at the table.

They are really coming into their lunch offerings. Homemade soups are good and sandwiches are for the most part, darn good. Large dining area, plenty of room to dine. I think they need to really work a bit harder to perfect their lunch offerings as they have with their desserts. I really do trust it will come together, but they need a really good menu chef to tie this all together. The pastry chef and lunch chef cannot be one in the same.

A little nudge, sometimes you hire some real goofs who are not 100% customer oriented, but rather just are there for a paycheck. And then I will say, most of your staff are really good folks who realize the customer is what keeps the doors open. Give this place a shot.

data.title: Great Atmosphere and place to hang out, plus good coffee and coconut macaroon! (not the french one)
data.text: I LOVE Layer, I am so glad they opened. They did a great job with the huge ceiling and original exposed brick. It is very roomy, lots of seating, nice chairs and tables. A great place to take a large group or just sit and read or do homework for hours without being crowded. I have eaten several things off the menu which is creative, though I think they could knock down each item a couple dollars. I enjoy the coffee, and my latte even had a bear made out of foam once! Young, friendly staff. The pastries could be bigger and cheaper, but I love the large coconut macaroons. NOTE: the French Macaroons are NOT homemade- they are shipped in. So, I don't think that is worth it. Get your macaroons from Botegga Louie in LA- Freshly made! Buying a large slice of cake for $5 is the best deal in the house. So, go get yourself a latte and a slice of cake and enjoy hanging out for a while. Welcome to Fullerton!

data.title: Bakery..yum, cafe yummier
data.text: This place is fairly new. It is in downtown Fullerton. The bakery has amazing cakes, cookies, cupcakes and scones. We had the turkey, avacoda sandwich on ciabatta. It was outstanding. We shared that and shared a salad as well. Great choice. Very tasty and filling. . There is another one on Irvine if that is closer for you.

data.title: 이쁜 케잌과 쿠키
data.text:
마카롱과 이쁜 케잌 쿠키 나름 괜찮은 인테리어와 넓은 실내~!
브런치 먹기에도 적당하고 맛은 중간정도
실내가 넓어서 편함
